trans-unit.source: Represents a surface for rendering adorners.
An adorner layer is guaranteed to be at a higher Z-order than the element(s) being adorned, so adorners are always rendered on top of the adorned element.
> [!NOTE] > The parent of an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Adorner> is the AdornerLayer that renders the **Adorner**, not the element being adorned.
> [!NOTE] > Anything placed in the adorner layer is rendered on top of the rest of any styles you have set.
In other words, adorners are always visually on top and cannot be overridden using z-order.
Adds an adorner to the adorner layer.
The adorner to add.
Raised when *adorner* is **null**.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Media.AdornerHitTestResult"></xref> for a specified point.
An <xref:System.Windows.Media.AdornerHitTestResult> contains the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> that was hit, and the adorner that the visual is part of.
The point to hit test.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Media.AdornerHitTestResult"></xref> for the specified point.
Positions child elements and determines a size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref>.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ArrangeOverride%2A>.
The size reserved for this element by its parent.
The actual size needed by the element.
This return value is typically the same as the value passed to *finalSize*.
Returns the first adorner layer in the visual tree above a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref>.
This `static` method traverses up the visual tree starting at the specified <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> and returns the first adorner layer found.
The visual element for which to find an adorner layer.
An adorner layer for the specified visual, or **null** if no adorner layer can be found.
Raised when *visual* is **null**.
Returns an array of adorners that are bound to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> to retrieve an array of adorners for.
An array of adorners that decorate the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>, or **null** if there are no adorners bound to the specified element.
Gets a child at the specified index position.
A derived class must implement this method to support <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> children.
The method must return the child at the specified index.
The index must be between `0` and (<xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer.VisualChildrenCount%2A>`-1`).
The index position of the wanted <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> child of the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> element.
Gets an enumerator that can iterate the logical child elements of this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref> element.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator>.
This property has no default value.
Measures the size required for child elements and determines a size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer> should be the same size as its parent and consume no layout space.
This method overrides <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.MeasureOverride%2A>.
Unused.
This method always returns a <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of (0,0).
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Adorner"></xref> from the adorner layer.
This method simply returns if the specified adorner does not exist.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.Adorner"></xref> to remove.
Raised when *adorner* is **null**.
Updates the layout and redraws all of the adorners in the adorner layer.
Updates the layout and redraws all of the adorners in the adorner layer that are bound to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> associated with the adorners to update.
Raised when *element* is **null**.
Raised when the specified element cannot be found.
Gets the number of child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects in this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref>.
Derived classes override this property to enable the Visual code to enumerate the Visual children.
Derived classes need to return the number of children from this method.
The number of child <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> objects in this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer"></xref>.
